Hello everybody. I'm having a problem with compiling ImageView.jl on Julia 1.5.3 - Ubuntu 20.04
It seems to be a problem with finding a Cairo library. I tried to rebuild ImageView after reinstalling libpangocairo but that didn't work. Here the initial log of the error:

`julia> using ImageView`
`[ Info: Precompiling ImageView [86fae568-95e7-573e-a6b2-d8a6b900c9ef]`
`ERROR: LoadError: LoadError: InitError: could not load library "/home/username/.julia/artifacts/079e2f87254bb2465a44de255cd5dde50d4d0b62/lib/libpangocairo-1.0.so"`
`/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpangoft2-1.0.so.0: undefined symbol: pango_font_get_hb_font`

Should I export that lib somehow so that Julia can see it? What am I missing here?
Thanks in advance for any support.

text: you shouldn't have that `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` at all :grimacing:

like, if you run
```LD_LIBRARY_PATH="" julia```
and try to use `ImageView` there, that should work
Ooooh! That worked indeed, thanks! Yeah got it, Julia is trying to use the x68_64 system libs  and it shouldn't.
